Single Cell Schemas

Study ID Required
Name study_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the study
Example A7F9B3X2
Reference https://schema.org/id
Regex ^[a-zA-Z0-9]+$
First Name Required
Name contact_first_name
Description Given first name
Example Jane
Reference https://schema.org/givenName
Regex ^[a-zA-Z]+$
Last Name Required
Name contact_last_name
Description Given last name
Example Doe
Reference https://schema.org/familyName
Regex ^[a-zA-Z]+$
Email Required
Name contact_email
Description Valid email address
Example janedoe@example.com
Reference https://schema.org/email
Regex ^[\w-\.]+@([\w-]+\.)+[\w-]{2,4}$
Institution Required
Name institutionCode
Description The code or abbreviation representing the lead institution responsible for the study.
Example Example Institute
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/institutionCode
Regex
Title Required
Name title
Description An official title for the study or project. Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.
Example Study of Spatial Transcriptomics Sequencing
Reference http://purl.org/dc/terms/title
Regex
Description Required
Name description
Description A detailed description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach. Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication
Example This project explores the intricate details of spatial transcriptomics sequencing.
Reference http://purl.org/dc/terms/description
Regex
Bibliographic Citation Required
Name bibliographicCitation
Description A citation for the study resource, following a standard format
Example Doe J., et al. (2024). Spatial Transcriptomic Analysis. Journal of Biology.
Reference http://purl.org/dc/terms/bibliographicCitation
Regex
Created Required
Name created
Description The date when the study was created or registered.
Example 2024-10-14
Reference http://purl.org/dc/terms/created
Regex
Workflow
Name workflow
Description The workflow or protocol followed during the study.
Example spatial_transcriptomics
Reference
Regex
Allowed Values microfluidics, facs, sequencing microfluidics, facs, culturing microfluidics, facs, culturing, sequencing spatial_transcriptomics laser_microdissection lasermicrodissection, culturing lasermicrodissection, culturing, sequencing laser_microdissection, sequencing
Sample ID Required
Name sample_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier assigned to the sample in the study.
Example sample123
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C16576
Regex
Study Reference Required
Name study_reference
Description A reference to the study, usually a unique identifier or citation.
Example study123
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C16576
Regex
Strain
Name strain
Description The strain of the organism, if applicable.
Example NA
Reference http://www.ebi.ac.uk/efo/EFO_0005135
Regex
Tissue
Name tissue
Description The type of tissue sampled for the study.
Example Leaf
Reference https://schema.org/tissueSample
Regex
Allowed Values Blade Bract Bud Cap Flower Gill fungi Holdfast fungi Leaf Mycelium Mycorrhiza Petiole Root Seed Seedling Shoot Spore Spore bearing structure Stem Stipe Thallus fungi Thallus plant Whole plant Other Other fungal tissue Other plant tissue Not applicable Not collected Not provided
Preservation Method
Name preservation_method
Description A brief description of how the sample was preserved.
Example Fresh
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C19232
Regex
Allowed Values Air dried Dry ice Ethanol/Dry ice slurry Lyophilised RNALater Snap frozen Other Not applicable Not collected Not provided
Age Class
Name AgeClass
Description The age class of the organism at the time of collection.
Example ADULT
Reference http://digir.net/schema/conceptual/darwin/2003/1.0/version/AgeClass-2003-06-17
Regex
Allowed Values Adult Egg Juvenile Larva Pupa Seed Spore Other Not applicable Not collected Not provided
Collection Date
Name collection_date
Description The date when the sample was collected.
Example 2024-09-20
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C81286
Regex ^[0-9]{4}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{2}$
Geographic Location Latitude Required
Name geographic_location_latitude
Description The geographic latitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -90 and 90. We advise that locations are specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and a maximum of 8 decimal places (https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees).
Example 52.62
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100309
Regex ^[-+]?([1-8]?\d(\.\d+)?|90(\.0+)?)$
Geographic Location Longitude Required
Name geographic_location_longitude
Description The geographic longitude where the specimen or sample was taken in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180. We advise that locations are specified to a minimum of 3 decimal places and maximum of 8 decimal places (https: //en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decimal_degrees).
Example 1.297
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0100310
Regex ^[-+]?([1-8]?\d(\.\d+)?|90(\.0+)?)$
Broad Scale Environmental Context
Name broad_scale_environmental_context
Description Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
Example Urban
Reference
Regex
Local Scale Environmental Context
Name local_scale_environmental_context
Description Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
Example Laboratory
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000027
Regex
Environmental Medium
Name environmental_medium
Description Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
Example Tissue culture medium
Reference http://purl.org/dc/terms/medium
Regex
Day
Name day
Description The integer day of the month on which the sample was collected.
Example 15
Reference
Regex ^(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])$
Life Stage
Name lifeStage
Description The life stage or age class of the organism when sampled.
Example Adult
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage
Regex ^(Adult|Egg|Embryo|Gametophyte|Juvenile|Larva|Pupa|Spore bearing structure|Sporophyte|Vegetative cell|Vegetative structure|Zygote|Not applicable|Not collected|Not provided)$
Allowed Values Adult Egg Embryo Gametophyte Juvenile Larva Pupa Spore bearing structure Sporophyte Vegetative cell Vegetative structure Zygote Not applicable Not collected Not provided
Material Entity ID
Name materialEntityID
Description A unique unique alphanumeric identifier for the material entity (sample).
Example matEnt12345
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialEntityID
Regex ^[A-Z]{3}-\d+$
Month
Name month
Description The month when the sample was collected.
Example 07
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/month
Regex ^(0[1-9]|1[0-2])$
Record Number
Name recordNumber
Description A unique number assigned to this record.
Example rec123
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/recordNumber
Regex
Taxon Rank
Name taxonRank
Description The rank of the taxon for this organism.
Example Species
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/taxonRank
Regex ^[A-Za-z]+$
Allowed Values Species Subspecies
Year
Name year
Description The four-digit year in which the sample was collected.
Example 2024
Reference http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/year
Regex ^\d{4}$
Imaging Protocol ID Required
Name imaging_protocol_id
Description A unique identifier for the sample used in the study.
Example SAMPLE123
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C16576
Regex
Platform Required
Name platform
Description The platform used to isolate the cells.
Example Illumina NovaSeq
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C142729
Regex
Instrument Required
Name instrument
Description The instrument used to isolate the cells.
Example Illumina NovaSeq 6000
Reference http://schema.org/instrument
Regex
Dissociation Method
Name dissociation_method
Description The method used for dissociating the cells.
Example enzymatic
Reference
Regex
Allowed Values enzymatic
Dissociation Time
Name dissociation_time
Description The time duration for dissociation in minutes.
Example 30
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/XCO_0000153
Regex
Dissociation Temperature
Name dissociation_temperature
Description The temperature at which dissociation is performed in degrees celsius.
Example 37
Reference
Regex
Dissociation Enzyme
Name dissociation_enzyme
Description The enzyme used for dissociation.
Example collagenase
Reference
Regex
Allowed Values collagenase
Dissociation Enzyme Concentration
Name dissociation_enzyme_concentration
Description The concentration of the dissociation enzyme.
Example 0.25
Reference http://semanticscience.org/resource/SIO_001088
Regex
Material Incubation Temperature
Name material_incubation_temperature
Description The temperature at which the material is incubated in degrees C.
Example 37
Reference
Regex
Material Incubation Time
Name material_incubation_time
Description The time duration for material incubation in hours.
Example 30
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/XCO_0000153
Regex
Lysis Buffer Solution
Name lysis_buffer_solution
Description The solution used for lysis buffer.
Example RIPA buffe
Reference
Regex
Target Probes Required
Name target_probes
Description The type of probes used to detect and quantify specific RNA molecules in their native spatial context within a tissue or cell.
Example Oligo-dT
Reference
Regex
Section Thickness Μm
Name section_thickness_µm
Description The thickness of the tissue section in micrometres.
Example 10
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C176286
Regex
Section Thickness Method
Name section_thickness_method
Description The method used to measure tissue section thickness.
Example Microtome
Reference
Regex
Section Thickness Temperature
Name section_thickness_temperature
Description The temperature at which the section was made.
Example Room temperature
Reference
Regex
Is Pathological
Name is_pathological
Description A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being abnormal and having a destructive effect on living tissue.
Example No
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/PATO_0001869
Regex
Digestion Workflow
Name digestion_workflow
Description A link to a workflow describing the digestion protocol in Protocols.io
Example Spatial transcriptomics dissociation
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/MSIO_0000144
Regex
Digestion Time In Minutes
Name digestion_time_in_minutes
Description The duration of digestion in minutes.
Example 45
Reference
Regex
Digestion Temperature
Name digestion_temperature
Description The temperature at which digestion was carried out.
Example 37
Reference
Regex
Photobleaching Duration in Hours
Name photobleaching_duration_in_hours
Description The duration of photobleaching in hours
Example 2
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OMIT_0022867
Regex
Instrument User Guide Required
Name instrument_user_guide
Description The user guide for the instrument used.
Example User Guide v1.2
Reference
Regex
Instrument User Guide Revision Required
Name instrument_user_guide_revision
Description The revision of the instrument user guide.
Example 1.2
Reference
Regex

Name sample_preparation_guide
Description The guide used for sample preparation.
Example preparation_guide_v1.0.pdf
Reference
Regex
Sample Preparation Guide Revision Required
Name sample_preparation_guide_revision
Description The revision of the sample preparation guide.
Example 1.0
Reference
Regex
Deviations from Official Protocol Required
Name deviations_from_official_protocol
Description Any deviations from the official protocol. Separate individual deviations with '|'.
Example None
Reference
Regex
Library Preparation ID Required
Name library_preparation_id
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the library preparation protocol used during the sequencing.
Example libPrep123
Reference
Regex
I5 Sequence
Name i5_sequence
Description The nucleotide sequence of the i5 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.
Example ATCGTAGC
Reference
Regex
I7 Sequence
Name i7_sequence
Description The nucleotide sequence of the i7 index used in multiplexing during sequencing.
Example CGTACGTA
Reference
Regex
Sequencing Reference Required
Name sequencing_reference
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
Example seq123
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0000316
Regex
Library Preparation Kit Required
Name library_preparation_kit
Description The kit used for library preparation.
Example 10X Genomics Single Cell 3' v3
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000085
Regex
Library Preparation Kit Version Required
Name library_preparation_kit_version
Description The version number of the library preparation kit used for sequencing.
Example Illumina TruSeq v2
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000149
Regex
Amplification Method
Name amplification_method
Description The method used to amplify the cDNA, e.g. "PCR".
Example PCR
Reference
Regex
Cdna Amplification Cycles
Name cDNA_amplification_cycles
Description The number of cycles used during the cDNA amplification process.
Example 12
Reference
Regex
Average Size Distribution
Name average_size_distribution
Description The average size of the DNA fragments generated during library preparation.
Example 200-300
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002138
Regex
Library Construction Method
Name library_construction_method
Description The library construction method (including version) that was used, e.g. "Smart-Seq2", "Drop-Seq", "10X v3".
Example Spatial Transcriptomics 3' V2 Library Prep
Reference
Regex
Input Molecule
Name input_molecule
Description The specific fraction of biological macromolecule from which the sequencing library is derived, e.g. "polyA RNA".
Example RNA
Reference
Regex
Primer
Name primer
Description The type of primer used for reverse transcription, e.g. "oligo-dT" or "random" primer. This allows users to identify content of the cDNA library input, e.g. enriched for mRNA.
Example Poly(A) oligo(dT)
Reference
Regex
End Bias
Name end_bias
Description The end bias of the library.
Example 3
Reference
Regex
Allowed Values 3 5
Library Strand
Name library_strand
Description The strand from which the library was derived
Example Single-stranded
Reference
Regex
Allowed Values unstranded sense antisense
Spike-in
Name spike_in
Description Spike-in RNAs are RNA molecules with known sequence that are added to the cell lysis mix. For instance, the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) spike in set is commonly used in scRNA-seq experiments.
Example ERCC control RNA
Reference
Regex
Spike In Dilution Or Concentration
Name spike_in_dilution_or_concentration
Description The final concentration or dilution (for commercial sets) of the spike in mix
Example 1:1000
Reference
Regex
Sequencing Reference Required
Name sequencing_reference
Description A unique alphanumeric reference or identifier for the sequencing protocol.
Example seq123
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0000316
Regex
Technical Replicate Group or Library Reference
Name technical_replicate_group_or_library_reference
Description A common term for all runs or files belonging to the same cell or library. It is recommended to use a stable sample accession from a biosample archive like BioSample. Alternatively, the library ID can be referenced from which the files were generated.
Example lib1
Reference
Regex
Sequencing Platform Name
Name sequencing_platform_name
Description The name of the sequencing platform used for the experiment.
Example Paired-end
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C172274
Regex
Sequencing Instrument Model
Name sequencing_instrument_model
Description This refers to the specific machine or platform used to carry out the sequencing process. Different models can have varying throughput, read lengths, error rates, and application suitability.
Example Illumina NovaSeq 6000
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0000149
Regex
Library Layout Required
Name library_layout
Description The type of library layout used for sequencing.
Example single
Reference http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C150423
Regex
Allowed Values single paired

Name reads_per_sample
Description The number of sequencing reads generated per sample.
Example 1000000

Checksum
Name checksum
Description Result of a hash function calculated on the file content to assert file integrity. Commonly used algorithms are MD5 and SHA-1.
Example d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e
Reference
Regex
White List Barcode File
Name white_list_barcode_file
Description A file containing the known cell barcodes in the dataset.
Example test_file.txt
Reference
Regex
Inferred Cell Type
Name inferred_cell_type
Description Post analysis cell type or identity declaration based on expression profile or known gene function identified by the performer.
Example type II bipolar neuron
Reference
Regex
Post Analysis Cell Well Quality
Name post_analysis_cell_well_quality
Description Performer defined measure of whether the read output from the cell was included in the sequencing analysis. For example, cells might be excluded if a threshold percentage of reads did not map to the genome or if pre-sequencing quality measures were not passed. E.g. "pass" or "fail".
Example High quality
Reference
Regex
Other Derived Cell Attributes
Name other_derived_cell_attributes
Description Any other cell level measurement or annotation as result of the analysis. E.g. cluster, gene count, UMI count, tSNE coordinates.
Example cluster
Reference
Regex
